Comment:
I used to play this line quite a lot back then. I had picked it up from an article that I had read on Anti-Sicilian openings.

These days, I much less afraid of playing 4. d4. These days, I feel that the consequences for white of black responding cxd4 are not disturbing enough to justify Anti-Sicilian play.

4. Bxc6, bxc6 is more usual and I think probably stronger. Here black has weakened its claim to the centre and opened the d file. 

This is probably pretty playable (especially against weaker opposition?) but was this perhaps the first sign of over-confidence from black?
Contorting to avoid cxd4.
Contorting to avoid cxd4.
Contorting to avoid cxd4.

After exchanging the bishop with the knight and so achieving the doubled pawns on the c file, I now threaten to take black's undefended pawn and perhaps help remove the black's doubled pawn problem?

Nc3 probably better.

Nc3 probably better.
I used threats in this game to illicit a response from my opponent, hoping that pressure would lead to an error.
Why not Nc3? - the bishop has lost a little bit of movement.
Not a great move by black. With the doubled pawns, the white squared bishop does not look very threatening on b2.
White is looking cramped. Only plus is that a lot of white's strength is building in the centre of the board.
Black is now looking a fair bit ahead. The space on the board looks better suited for black's bishops than white's knights.

I'm about to throw everything that I have into attacking h7.
Keeps the pressure on h7.
Keeps the pressure on h7.
Threatens h7# - black has to respond.
Threatens h7# - black has to respond.

I was so keen to maintain the threat of h7# that I'm willing to lose material.

Not an amazing strategy, what else is really on for white though?

That was forced. Neither side is looking too great here. Black is maybe still a bit ahead but the exposed King is cause for concern (and proved decisive).

Protects white's knight from the Queen so it can stay deep. A simple f6 though and black can brush away that problem.

I guess preparing to chase away white's queen with the rook.

It didn't worry him and I gain a pawn.

Black still ahead. White's rooks totally ineffectual.
